＼技術ブログ公開しました🧑‍💻／

「SSI/DID/VCとOpenID4VC/Hyperledger Aries/Web5について」
デベロッパーエキスパート 神沼 貴大(@t_kanuma)が登壇！

イベントで実施した内容をおさらい
動画や資料もあるので、是非振り返りや当日参加できなかった方は是非ご活用ください！

#GMOdev

IOGは、分散型アイデンティティツールのスイートであるAtala PRISMをHyperledger Foundationに提供しました。これはOpen Enterprise Agentとして構築され、W3C標準とHyperledger Aries RFCsに準拠しています。ブロックチェーン非依存を目指し、オープンソースでの開発とコミュニティ参加を重視しています。

主な特徴には、言語の柔軟性のためのREST API、Cardanoブロックチェーンとの統合、クラウドベースの設計、JVMの互換性、様々なクレデンシャルタイプのサポート、DIDCommプロトコルのサポートが含まれています。このエージェントはデジタルアイデンティティの未来に向けて多機能なツールとして位置付けられています。

記事・翻訳 
🔽 
https://t.co/SRfQaosXb8
#Cardano #ADA #カルダノ

Today we write. Topic?? The successful use of Hyperledger Aries as cyber defense. Currently at 4 of 25 pages and it’s due tomorrow by 11:59pm. Talk about stressed! My priorities have been all out of whack lately and it’s largely due to me helping inconsiderate ass ppl 🫠

新しい記事を書きました。

Issuerがdid:webでVCに署名できるようACA-PyのPluginを実装し、AWS上にDID Documentをホストする形にして、Indy Ledgerを用いずにLDP-VCの発行と検証を行った結果を共有しています。

【Hyperledger Aries】did:webでLDP-VCの発行と検証を試す
https://t.co/gkDLhSsBIM

Next up is using your did:web did for AnonCreds, add support for DIDComm / AnonCreds to the API (only builder at the moment), and Token Status List for SD-JWT VC revocation.

What else should we add?

We just released some new features for paradym. You can now update and archive SD-JWT VC templates from the dashboard, and use did:web for DIDComm invitations

https://t.co/0syxTayqD5
We use DIDCOMM on the @HPECid app! We use secure direct messaging between doctors connected on the application.

Do you use #DIDComm? We want to hear about it!

https://t.co/Vl0FEOSMZg https://t.co/KHNGtapoOb

@DecentralizedID We use DIDCOMM on the @HPECid app!
Secure direct messaging between doctors connected on the application.
DIDCommってどう試せばいいんやろ？

Learn how you can connect to IoT devices through DIDComm from Indicio Senior Software Engineer Colton Wolkins!

See a quick demonstration of the technology in action, as well as a breakdown on why you would want to use DIDComm for IoT and how it works: https://t.co/XLb2OuIBaD

The benefits of both #OpenID4VC and #DIDComm have been brought together by @IDunion_SCE, a demonstration of which was offered at the latest @idworkshop.

See the demonstration and discuss the tech for yourself in the next Indicio Meetup!
https://t.co/giUwPqXaAu
@DecentralizedID https://t.co/ELj4dW3vCW

@idworkshop day 2 is full of new and interesting ideas! 

Be sure to stop by Demo table 15 to see Colton Wolkins demonstrating how DIDComm can offer better privacy and security for IoT devices while maintaining their convenience. https://t.co/jNrvNsFHV5
The API does not yet support AnonCreds over DIDComm, but that's coming soon 👀. We'll be supporting all leading identity standards and regulations.

At #IIW joined a session by @TelegramSam about #IDUnion's work to bootstrap #DIDComm connections using #OID4VC protocols. Nice surprise to see they used our libraries and SDKs for the PoC.
https://t.co/H8A45w4GH5
🧰 Advancements in DIF work items featuring sessions on Presentation Exchange v2.1, Credential Trust Establishment, Credential Schemas and Open ID with DIDcomm.

🚪Not all auths are created equal - it's FIDO *+* OIDC *+* DIDcomm based on what you're trying to do

⏳VCs don't have to be static — how we enable 2 way updates

📵 Device agnosticism — ways to avoid mobile dependence 

♻️ "Someone else's data" & the 'always has been' meme

One docker command and you have a cloud agent running that supports DIDComm, OpenID4VC, AnonCreds, SD-JWT, W3C JWT/JSON-LD, indy, cheqd, did:web and a lot of other features at your disposal with a convenient Swagger UI 👀

Now time for some proper docs...

https://t.co/8LRe31oLHm

@vpavlin @d_szlachta @Waku_org @Codex_storage Only once I intend to sync between my own devices do I intend to “message”, but that means I need a storage architecture first with a method to determine which pieces of state are missing. The decentralized identity community debated this for the tradeoffs of DWNs vs DIDComm

Today, Paradym supports DIDComm and AnonCreds. Next month, we will add support for OpenID4VC and SD-JWT VCs, and later this year, we will ship mDL / mDOC. Whatever standard you need, we can build it. 🚀

A day ago I was writing about $FET AI agents and how important is to verify their data. 

Today @rosspower  & @okay_nick talked about verified AI Agents whit three core standards : 

- DIDs 
- Verifiable Credentials 
- DIDComm

#vAI is not anymore a question, its just happening ! 

@cheqd_io  x @veramolabs 🔥

Verifiable AI (#vAI) is coming. Identity projects are mobilised to provide solutions for various use cases to enable compliant and ethical AI models.

vAI offers consumer assurance and a competitive business advantage. 

Don't fade verifiable data.

We're here to answer the call.

Awesome to see @okay_nick a friend from @veramolabs which has been huge for us @cheqd_io 

Nick is proposing an AI agent framework with 3 core standards 
- DIDs
- Verifiable Credentials
- DIDComm

If you build agents with these frameworks it becomes much easier and more flexible to add agents into the system

Excited to explore how we can help make this happen @veramolabs - taking on a call to action from what’s missing in decentralised identity right now to make it happen

ETHG ensures anonymity of digital assets through ring signature technology. Each transaction has a unique key image to prevent double spending. Leveraging W3C's Distributed Identifiers (DID) and Verifiable Credentials specifications, ETHG establishes a distributed digital identity framework, enabling effective operation of verifiable credential circulation models. 🔄💼

ETHG features a built-in smart contract module package, bridging external service modules (like RPC) and underlying infrastructure modules (such as network, storage, and account modules). Other modules like storage, basic encryption algorithms, and network provide foundational support to smart contracts. Smart contracts are defined by upper-layer applications, interpreted by interpreters, stored by storage modules, and executed by the ETHG smart contract module package. The ETHG smart contract interpreter supports multiple high-level programming languages, allowing developers to design smart contracts using their preferred language. 💡💻

In addition to supporting Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) and Smart Contracts, ETHG also embraces the latest Layer2 technology. Layer2 builds upon Layer1 to provide richer functionality, aiming to solve the 'Blockchain Trilemma' and enhance network speed, efficiency, and scalability while maintaining security and decentralization. #ETHG #Layer2 #BlockchainInnovation #Web3

Through our partnership with Beitou, ZCert becomes the first global W3C-compliant Verifiable Credential implementation. Initially, it will be utilized by Chinese domestic nationals to digitize their National ID or driving license. These Verifiable Credentials can then be presented abroad and authenticated by any verifier. Beitou IT's integration with China's nationwide police and transport department databases ensures seamless authentication.
